page.title: 18Health Centre, Eccleston
page.content: In response to a long campaign for one, the Health Centre opened in 1981. Two health visitors have responsibility for schools within the locality and for co-ordination of health and social services for the whole community. A chiropody service is available for older people, and once a week there is a special clinic for the over sixty-fives, giving advice on health and social problems. A mother and baby welfare clinic is held once a week. Based at the Centre are District Nurses who make home visits to care for the elderly, or to provide aftercare following hospital treatment. One family doctor holds his surgeries on the premises. There is no dentist or optician at present.
